column1: #Text=Mozilla Thunderbird 1.0, a free open-source mail user agent, has been released within the last twenty-four hours by the Mozilla Foundation.
#Text=Thunderbird has been in development for more than one and a half years.
#Text=The release of Thunderbird 1.0 comes less than one month after the Foundation released Firefox 1.0, its internet browser.
#Text=The new version contains many updates in the areas of security and ease of use.
#Text=A newsgroup and a RSS reader is integrated into the application, which also features adaptive junk mail filters.
#Text=Common mail protocols POP3 and IMAP are both supported, so users will be able to access some brands of webmail from within the program.
#Text=Thunderbird is directly competing with Microsoft Outlook.
